thread_title: LeadEngine Platform Conception & Full Build Specification

1_narrative.title: Narrative & Context
items: User saw RB2B (website visitor identification tool) promoted on YouTube and asked to research it.
From that research, user conceived a far more comprehensive product called LeadEngine, rejecting a pure RB2B clone as insufficient for B2C needs.

The session pivoted to fully defining the LeadEngine platform, including 6 core modules, a 7-day build sprint, deployment architecture, and supporting systems like a Design Workbench and video production workflow.
The session concluded with a book and content strategy concept to support marketing.

2_objectives.title: Objectives
items: Research RB2B tool and its capabilities.
Define a comprehensive product (LeadEngine) that solves the identified gaps, particularly for B2C businesses like estate agents.
Create a complete build specification for LeadEngine, including all modules, screens, tech stack, and deployment.
Design supporting systems: a Design Workbench for efficient screen mockup creation and a video production workflow.
Plan deployment architecture and pricing.
Outline a book and content strategy to market the platform.

3_success_criteria.title: Success Criteria
items: A complete product concept with 6 defined core modules.
A detailed build spec with 94 deliverables (42 app screens, 18 marketing screens, etc.).
A defined 7-day build sprint plan.
Clear deployment models (Hosted and Dedicated Container) and pricing tiers.
Supporting systems (Design Workbench, video workflow) defined and ready for implementation.
Revenue target of £5,000/month per client.

4_decisions.title: Decisions & Rules
items: Rejected building a pure RB2B clone; company-level identification alone is insufficient for B2C.
Committed 100% to building LeadEngine as a comprehensive platform.
Pricing set at £5,000/month per client for hosted version.
Dedicated container deployment priced at +£2,500/month premium.
Build will use Next.js + React frontend, FastAPI or Next.js API routes, PostgreSQL, Redis, ChromaDB, Claude API, IPinfo.io, Apollo.io, Resend, Twilio.
Video production will use Remotion + Claude, not After Effects/DaVinci templates or AI decomposition of YouTube videos.
Will build a simple DAM instead of using ImageKit initially.
AI model default is Claude, hidden from client; enterprise option allows bringing own API key.
Update delivery: Hosted updates instantly, Container updates via Watchtower auto-pull nightly.
JS snippet loads tracking pixel + concierge widget in Shadow DOM to avoid CSS conflicts.
Multi-branch support via branch parameter in pixel initialization.

5_sops.title: SOPs / Workflows
items: 7-Day Build Sprint: Day 1-2: Foundation + AI concierge engine; Day 3-4: Visitor intelligence + lead capture + scoring; Day 5: Routing + analytics; Day 6: Automation + Docker packaging; Day 7: Marketing site + launch prep.

Remotion Video Workflow: 1. User provides brand assets + UI screenshots. 2. User writes storyboard using motion lexicon terms. 3. Claude writes Remotion React code. 4. `npx remotion render` → MP4 output.

Knowledge Base Ingestion: 1. Website scrape (daily auto-refresh). 2. File upload (CSV/PDF/Word). 3. Google Sheets sync (hourly refresh). 4. CRM integration (Reapit, Alto, Jupix, Expert Agent APIs). 5. API webhook (real-time updates).
Design Workbench: Use Fabric.js canvas + Figma API renderer + component browser from PostgreSQL to mock up screens from 38 UI kits.
Deployment: Dedicated container model uses one Docker Compose per client, deployed via a script taking ~30 minutes.

6_scripts.title: Scripts / Commands
items: JS Snippet: `le('init', 'CLIENT_ID', { branch: 'brixton' })`
Remotion render command: `npx remotion render`

7_inputs_outputs.title: Inputs & Outputs
items: Inputs: RB2B research data, user's vision and quotes, 38 existing UI kits in PostgreSQL, brand assets (logo, colours, fonts, UI screenshots) for video, knowledge base sources (URLs, files, sheets, CRM APIs).

Outputs: COMPLETE_BUILD_SPEC.md, DESIGN_WORKBENCH_SPEC.md, VIDEO_PRODUCTION_SPEC.md, DEPLOYMENT_SPEC.md, BOILERPLATE_SELECTIONS.md (updated), Session summary, Full session log, MEMORY.md (updated), kit_roles.md (created), Motion Lexicon (171 terms across 11 categories), 94 defined deliverables (screens, posts, videos, sequences, graphics).

8_missteps.title: Missteps / Errors / Risks
items: Initial plan to download and decompose After Effects/DaVinci templates for video was abandoned as inefficient.
Considered using YouTube URLs → Google AI Studio → effect library → Remotion, but also abandoned.
Risk: Building a simple DAM instead of using ImageKit may require later migration if scaling needs arise.
Risk: LLM cost estimated at ~£70-230/mo per client, baked into price.

9_blockers.title: Blockers
items: Browsing 12,000+ UI component thumbnails manually for design mockups was identified as too slow, prompting the Design Workbench solution.
Screen Studio ($89) is gold standard for screen recording but Mac only; user is on Windows, so FocuSee or Rapidemo are alternatives.

10_status.title: Status
items: Planning and specification phase complete. Build sprint is defined but not yet started. Tomorrow's focus is on Design Workbench MVP and starting mockups.

12_refinements.title: Refinements
items: Product evolved from a simple RB2B clone to the comprehensive LeadEngine platform.
Video production approach refined from using templates to a Remotion + Claude code generation workflow.

13_dependencies.title: Dependencies
items: Existing UI kits (38) stored in PostgreSQL for the Design Workbench.
External APIs: Claude API, IPinfo.io ($99/mo), Apollo.io, Resend, Twilio.
Figma API for component rendering.
CRM APIs (Reapit, Alto, Jupix, Expert Agent) for knowledge base integration.
Docker for container deployment.
Watchtower for container updates.

14_entities.title: Entity Maps
items: LeadEngine: The main platform product.
Core Modules: AI Concierge, Visitor Intelligence, Lead Capture & Scoring, Lead Routing, Funnel Analytics & Leak Detection, Automation & Sequences.
RB2B: Competitor/Inspiration tool for visitor identification.
Design Workbench: Tool for creating screen mockups using Fabric.js, Figma API, and a DAM.
Remotion: Framework for programmatic video generation.
Motion Lexicon: 171-term library for describing animations.
Knowledge Base: Vector store (ChromaDB) for AI Concierge context.
Deployment Models: Hosted SaaS (app.leadengine.io) and Dedicated Container (Docker Compose per client).
Branches: Sub-divisions within a client account (e.g., geographic offices).

15_glossary.title: Glossary
items: RAG: Retrieval-Augmented Generation.
DAM: Digital Asset Management.
SLA: Service Level Agreement.
ARPU: Average Revenue Per User.
LLM: Large Language Model.
Shadow DOM: Web standard for encapsulating widget CSS/HTML.
Watchtower: Tool for auto-updating Docker containers.
Idempotent: Database migrations that can be run multiple times safely.

items: Session demonstrates a rapid pivot from research to comprehensive product conception and specification.
User emphasizes action over endless tinkering ('Fuck tinkering endlessly in the build stage').
Process involves creating detailed specs and reusable systems (Design Workbench, motion lexicon) to accelerate future work.
Content strategy is designed to be derivative, repurposing core material (book) into multiple formats (posts, emails, webinars).

summary: The session began with research into the RB2B visitor identification tool, which led to the conception of a much more comprehensive platform called LeadEngine, designed for B2C businesses like estate agents. A complete build specification was created, including 6 core modules, a 7-day sprint plan, deployment architecture, and supporting systems for design and video production. The session concluded with plans for a marketing book and content strategy.
